column7: First course in social statistics for students without mathematics beyond the high school level; topics include the role of statistics in social science inquiry, measures of central tendency and dispersion, simple correlation techniques, contingency analysis, and introduction to statistical inference; includes the statistical analysis of social science data using personal computers. Same as GEOG 280. Credit is not given for SOC 280 if credit for a college level introductory statistics course has been earned.
column9: Same as GEOG 280. Credit is not given for SOC 280 if credit for a college level introductory statistics course has been earned.
column11: Priority will be given to Sociology and Geography majors.
